title: PointObserver (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK ABSTRACT PointObserver IMPLEMENTS IPointObserverImpl
Base object for all DNP3 Master datapoint observer.
PointObserver can be used in conjunction with a Master to listen for DNP3 datapoint changes of a certain Outstation datapoint.
The PointObserver needs to be connected to a Master, pointNumber must be configured accordingly, the datapoint type is defined implicitly by the specific PointObserver - like
AnalogInputPointObserver
.
If enabled, the PointObserver signals datapoint changes at output modified for one call to the PointObserver instance (one IEC application cycle).
Eventually multiple changes to the datapoint can happen between two calls to the PointObserver instance (one IEC application cycle).
In this case only the most recent value is provided by the PointObserver, the application can detect such data loss by analysing the sequenceNumber did increment by more than the value 1.
This relatively simple approach should be sufficient for most use cases, especially as a Master can use an
IntegrityPoll
if needed, to get the most recent datapoint values from an outstation.
A more complex DNP3 datapoint observer providing capabilities to process all datapoint changes can be realized, but is subject to eventual future improvements.
In case the Master will be disabled during PointObserver normal operation (PointObserver.xEnable=TRUE)
the PointObserver will signal an error (xError=TRUE, eErrorID=MasterDisabled) and need to be disabled
and enabled again after the Master had been enabled to get back to normal operation.
It is adviced to set PointObserver.xEnable:=Master.xEnable.
